job_description:
Job Title: Head of Marketing Analytics

Location: USA Remote

Salary: $180-220k base + bonus

Embrace the opportunity to lead marketing analytics efforts at a leading financial technology brand, reporting directly to the Chief Data Officer. This role empowers you to shape the future of marketing strategy through data-driven insights.

Your Role:
• Collaborate with marketing and product teams to develop innovative marketing analytical services and solutions.
• Generate integrated recommendations to assess marketing effectiveness and measure program impact.
• Establish and report on KPIs to global Marketing leaders and executives.
• Shape an enterprise vision for advanced analytics contribution to corporate KPIs.
• Lead campaign-specific marketing analytics to quantify program value and effectiveness.
• Conduct customer modeling for targeted acquisition approaches.
• Provide recommendations to drive customer-centric decisions across the organization.
• Recruit, develop, and retain a world-class data science and analytics team.

Your Skills and Experience:
• Minimum BA/BS required; Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or relevant field strongly preferred.
• 10+ years in Analytics with 5+ years in data science and marketing analytics team management.
• Experience using BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform is a plus.
• Proficient in leading customer data science practices, including segmentation, churn, and predictive insights.
• Mastery in analyzing complex and multi-dimensional marketing and customer data sets.
• Expertise in campaign management and related technologies like multivariate experimentation and audience segmentation.
• Proven track record in shaping strategic business decisions through marketing measurements.
• Strong executive presence and reputation for delivering competitive insights.
• Familiarity with app/web analytics tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.
• Background in designing and leading data visualization toolsets.
• Experience building and leading marketing analytics teams.
• Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to navigate a global, matrixed organization.
